siren

Class Link.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • siren.Link.Builder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<Link>
    Enclosing class:
    Link

    public static class Link.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Builder<Link>
    A builder for Link instances.

      Constructs an instance of Link.Builder.

    • Method Detail

      • rel

        public Link.Builder rel(java.lang.String rel)
        Adds the relation provided to the current state of the builder.
        Parameters:
        rel - Defines the relationship of the link to its entity, per Web Linking (RFC5988) and Link Relations.
        Returns:
        The builder this method is called on.
        See Also:
        RFC5988, Link Relations

      • href

        public Link.Builder href(java.net.URI href)
        Sets the current state of the builder to have the href provided.
        Parameters:
        href - The URI of the linked resource.
        Returns:
        The builder this method is called on.

      • klass

        public Link.Builder klass(java.lang.String klass)
        Adds the class provided to the current state of the builder.
        Parameters:
        klass - Describes aspects of the link based on the current representation. Possible values are implementation-dependent and should be documented.
        Returns:
        The builder this method is called on.

      • title

        public Link.Builder title(java.lang.String title)
        Sets current state of the builder to have the title provided.
        Parameters:
        title - Text describing the nature of a link.
        Returns:
        The builder this method is called on.

      • type

        public Link.Builder type(java.lang.String type)
        Sets the current state of the builder to have the type provided.
        Parameters:
        type - Defines media type of the linked resource, per Web Linking (RFC5988). For the syntax, see RFC2045 (section 5.1), RFC4288 (section 4.2), RFC6838 (section 4.2)
        Returns:
        The builder this method is called on.
        See Also:
        RFC5988, RFC2045, RFC4288, RFC6838
